content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: India-Israel Ties Elevated To "Special Strategic Partnership" During PM's Visit
content: India and Israel on Thursday announced the elevation of their bilateral relationship to a "Special Strategic Partnership for Peace, Innovation and Prosperity", marking a significant expansion of cooperation across defence, technology and trade.

title: Instagram To Alert Parents When Teens Search For Suicide Terms
content: Instagram will begin notifying parents when their teenage children repeatedly search for content related to suicide or self-harm, platform owner Meta announced Thursday, as the company faces mounting legal pressure over its handling of young users.

title: White House Accused Of Hiding Trump Allegations In Epstein Files
content: The top Democrat on a congressional committee probing the Jeffrey Epstein scandal accused the White House Thursday of covering up revelations about President Donald Trump in files on the late sex offender.

title: Tigers Changing Stripes, Preying More Actively On Humans: Study
content: The growing number of tigers and humans has enhanced the man-animal conflict, leading to more instances of tiger attack.

title: China Sacks Minister, 9 Military Officials As Part Of Xi's Corruption Purge
content: They also voted to remove Liu Shaoyun from his position as head of the People's Liberation Army's military court, without explaining why.

title: In Historic First, US Deploys Stealth Fighters In Israel Amid Iran Tensions
content: The US has already gathered a fleet of aircraft and warships in the Middle East as a war looms over Iran. However, for the first time, the US has deployed combat aircraft to Israel for a potential war mission.

title: 'Heinous Individual, Didn't Know About Criminal Acts': Hillary Clinton On Epstein
content: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton told US House lawmakers that she did not know of late paedophile Jeffrey Epstein or his ex-associate Ghislaine Maxwell's crimes on the first day of depositions that will also include Bill Clinton.

title: Rs 35,000 A Day For Cheetah Meals? Political Storm Over Kuno Park Spending
content: Crores of rupees are being spent on feeding cheetahs at Kuno National Park, with the Madhya Pradesh government revealing in the Assembly that nearly Rs 35,000 is being spent every single day on goat meat for the big cats.

title: Afghanistan Retaliates, Launches "Large-Scale Offensive Ops" Against Pak
content: Afghanistan has launched offensive operations against Pakistani military positions along the border, the Taliban's spokesperson said on Thursday, in retaliation for recent Pakistani airstrikes.

title: Boy Missing For 6 Years, Parents Find Uncle, Aunt Buried Him Near Expressway
content: When a four-year-old boy went missing from Rajasthan's Dausa district in 2020, his family held onto the hope that they would find him one day. Six years later, that hope has turned into a nightmare.

title: State Obliged To Treat Prisoners With Humanity: Top Court On Prison Reforms
content: Supreme Court on Thursday directed all states and Union territories to develop a time-bound protocol for filling up existing vacancies in Open Correctional Institutions (OCI) and open barracks.

title: I'm Vegetarian, Served Non-Veg To J&K Students: Veep's Dietary Freedom Pitch
content: Vice President CP Radhakrishnan today strongly advocated for dietary freedom in the country. CP Radhakrishnan asked people to respect food choices and not to degrade the sentiments of others while being proud of your own.

title: Anil Ambani Questioned For 9 Hours In Laundering Case, Summoned Again Tomorrow
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday grilled Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani for more than nine hours during the second round of questioning in connection with an alleged bank fraud-linked money laundering case.

title: Bulldozer At Midnight: Bride's Father Flattens Groom's House In Gwalior
content: A love marriage at a small village in Gwalior district has morphed into a chilling tale of rage and retaliation, where a father allegedly turned a bulldozer into a weapon of vengeance.

content: Rohit Pawar, NCP (SP) MLA and Sharad Pawar's grandson, had called for the resignation of Union Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu over the fatal plane crash that killed his uncle and Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

title: Despite nesting decline, Wayanad‚Äôs vultures still soar
content: Although breeding has declined, experts say there is no immediate cause for concern  as the vulture population in Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary remains stable, with around 80 vultures recorded. Human disturbances can disrupt vulture breeding, while invasive species like Senna threaten the growth of native trees, further impacting nesting and foraging habitats.

title: 66 inmates died in Chhattisgarh jails since January 2025, govt. tells Assembly; tribal leader‚Äôs custodial death triggers uproar
content: Tribal leader Jeevan Thakur died on December 4 last year after falling ill while in judicial custody;the Opposition MLAs questioned the circumstances around his death and claimed that he had been implicated in a false case

content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan transfer the investigation to CBI after being dissatisfied with the probe conducted by CB-CID

title: Harvest season turns risky as rain and procurement hurdles hit farmers in Kerala
content: In many places, harvested paddy remains piled in the fields, exposed and vulnerable to the unseasonal summer rain. Farmers fear their crops can be ruined if the exposure continues

title: CM inaugurates State-level Pattaya mela; 4.56 lakh families get land rights during Pinarayi govts.
content: Chief Minister says government has focussed on ensuring land, housing, health care, and education for the underprivileged, aimed at creating a secure and dignified life for marginalised communities

title: '15 outposts captured, 40 Pak soldiers killed': Afghan Taliban launches big offensive
content: Afghanistan's military has retaliated with strikes against Pakistan following recent Pakistani airstrikes on Afghan soil, which Kabul claims killed dozens of civilians. Pakistan stated its operations targeted militant groups responsible for recent attacks within its borders. This escalation highlights deepening tensions between the two neighboring nations.

title: India batting comes back to life, keeps T20 World Cup campaign alive
content: From the strong powerplay to intent in the middle overs and a blockbuster finish‚Äîback-to-back sixes by Hardik Pandya‚ÄîIndia checked the boxes they were yearning to in the fixtures preceding Thursday's clash. Restoring the right-left combination at the top of the order worked wonders for the defending champions.

title: New challenge: ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô gets a pushback from US, China
content: Central to the disputes is India‚Äôs production-linked incentive programme, launched by the Modi government in 2020 with the aim of strengthening domestic manufacturing.

title: OPS likely to join DMK today ‚Äòto take on Palaniswami‚Äô
content: OPS, who has been fighting long ‚Äî and so far unsuccessful ‚Äî battles in courts and before Election Commission of India (ECI) to return to, if not regain control of AIADMK, is expected to join the rival party in the presence of chief minister and DMK president M K Stalin at Anna Arivalayam, the DMK headquarters.

title: Cognizant AI chief‚Äôs one-word take on Claude-triggered market wipeout
content: Cognizant's chief AI officer dismisses fears of AI disrupting IT services, stating enterprises still need significant support for AI deployment and integration. Despite advances in AI tools, businesses require assistance to effectively map and manage these systems, ensuring continued demand for services firms.

title: When tradition becomes torture: Inside Bihar‚Äôs pakadua vivah cases
content: Bihar witnesses a disturbing rise in 'pakadua vivah,' where men and boys are forced into marriage. Recent cases across districts like Samastipur and Patna involve students, teachers, and even minors abducted and wedded under duress. Viral social media videos expose these incidents, prompting urgent calls for stricter laws and swifter police action against perpetrators.

title: Candace Owens challenges Erika Kirk‚Äôs single mom claim
content: Candace Owens released the first episode of her series Bride of Charlie, where she accused Erika Kirk of misrepresenting her childhood. Owens claimed Erika was not raised solely by her mother, Lori Frantzve, and said her father and stepfather were present. Owens also said Lori ‚Äúmarried four times.‚Äù Erika Kirk has not responded.

title: What this teenager suffering from autism does with his money is so heartwarming
content: A 16-year-old reportedly autistic boy, Pratap Joshi, sells toys outside a mall in Dehradun to support his family, earning ‚Çπ500 daily. His situation highlights systemic gaps in support for families facing disability and financial crisis, sparking concern and calls for structured help and fundraising.

title: 7-yr-old lowered into well to rescue baby goat in Bihar's English village
content: A seven-year-old boy in Bihar displayed remarkable bravery, descending into a deep well to rescue a baby goat. Locals lowered him with a rope, and he successfully brought the animal back up. While the act of compassion was cheered, authorities are now investigating the risky rescue, emphasizing the need to protect children.

title: Horoscope Today: Daily astrological predictions for February 27
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 27, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: 'We have displaced people for AI': CEO of America's largest bank
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is urging businesses and governments to prepare for job disruption caused by artificial intelligence. He believes society should not wait for job losses to occur before addressing them. Dimon emphasizes that JPMorgan is embracing AI and has already redeployed employees displaced by the technology.

title: From Baramulla to the brink of history: Auqib Nabi's defining Ranji season
content: Auqib Nabi's exceptional bowling performance has propelled Jammu & Kashmir to the brink of a historic Ranji Trophy title. The seamer, who became the competition's leading wicket-taker, emphasized a simple, disciplined approach focusing on line and length. Nabi's success, attributed to strong wrist position for swing and movement, has fulfilled a long-held dream for J&K cricket.

title: Watch: IAF offers first glimpse of S-400 air defence system in action
content: The Indian Air Force has successfully completed its full dress rehearsal for Vayushakti-26 at Pokhran, validating all operational parameters. The exercise, set for February 27th, will showcase the IAF's swift threat neutralization capabilities, humanitarian aid roles, and the prowess of numerous indigenous aircraft and advanced weaponry, demonstrating its mission readiness and commitment to national security.

title: Anonymous GM Claims Tyreek Hill Is ‚ÄòDone‚Äô Even at Vet Minimum
content: Tyreek Hill just hit free agency after his Dolphins release, but at least one anonymous NFL GM says he‚Äôs ‚Äúdone‚Äù and not worth even a veteran-minimum deal. We break down why front offices see more risk than reward, how his ACL tear and off-field history factor in, and whether a discounted Chiefs reunion is still on the table.

title: Canucks react as Tyler Myers trade rumors heat up
content: Vancouver Canucks teammates are working on the rising NHL trade speculations that involve the defense veteran defenseman Tyler Myers before the deadline. Brock Boeser and Tom Willander were open about leadership, mentoring, and the possible exit of Myers. As Vancouver looks to the future, players understand the business aspect of hockey, at the same time recognizing the contributions that Myers has made in the locker room and on the ice.

title: WWE elimination chamber 2026: Date, venue, kickoff, how to watch
content: WWE Elimination Chamber 2026 is set for February 28th at Chicago's United Center, featuring high-stakes matches crucial for WrestleMania 42. The event will include the signature Men's and Women's Elimination Chamber bouts, establishing No. 1 contenders. Fans can watch live on Peacock in the US and Netflix in various international territories, with kickoff starting at 5 PM ET.

title: PLA in peril: Xi's purge cripples China's military; is Beijing vulnerable?
content: China's military purges are creating significant gaps in its command structure. This is impacting the readiness of the People's Liberation Army. The International Institute for Strategic Studies reports these issues.  The purges are expected to continue.  China's military spending is also rising in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Beyond Netflix and Narcos: The real story of drug cartels ruling over Mexico
content: The death of El Mencho did not end cartel power; it exposed how deeply entrenched it has become. This piece examines the real history behind the Netflix mythology, tracing the rise of Mexican cartels from Colombian cocaine transporters to global criminal empires. It explores how figures such as Miguel √Ångel F√©lix Gallardo and El Chapo built the system, how 9/11 reshaped trafficking routes, and how synthetic drugs industrialised the trade. It argues that cartel power persists because it is structural, not personal. El Mencho‚Äôs killing marks not a conclusion but a transition, as the system adapts once again, preparing to produce the next successor in an endless cycle.

title: India, Israel to resume FTA talks in May as both sides push for deeper trade ties
content: India and Israel are set to resume free trade agreement talks in May 2026 in Israel, following initial discussions in New Delhi. The negotiations cover a broad spectrum of trade and investment areas, aiming to unlock significant untapped potential. Despite recent trade dips, both nations are pushing for an ambitious pact to boost economic ties.

title: Explained: How your salary & benefits may change with labour codes and income tax reforms
content: At the heart of this transition is a unified definition of ‚Äúwages‚Äù under the labour codes - a seemingly simple reform that brings consistency and transparency to pay structures that have evolved over decades.

title: Gold, Silver valuation norms: SEBI shifts mutual funds to spot prices; new rules from April
content: Sebi has revamped how mutual funds value physical gold and silver, shifting to domestic spot prices from April 2026, replacing the LBMA benchmark. This move aims for greater transparency and alignment with Indian market conditions. Additionally, Sebi introduced a new scheme classification structure and tightened portfolio overlap disclosures to enhance investor protection and uniformity across the mutual fund industry.

title: SA vs WI: Proteas do India a favour, sink Windies to keep semifinal race alive
content: South Africa secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over the West Indies in their T20 World Cup Super 8 clash, extending their unbeaten tournament run. Disciplined bowling restricted the West Indies to 176 for 8, with a late partnership providing a competitive total. Captain Aiden Markram's unbeaten 82 led South Africa's strong chase, ensuring a comfortable win.

title: Trouble for Chidambaram: ED gets prosecution sanction in 2 money laundering cases
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a prosecution sanction order against former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis money laundering case. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling and aims to expedite the pending trial. The ED alleges Chidambaram granted FIPB approval for the deal in lieu of quid pro quo, with alleged illegal gratification received by his son.

title: Big relief for flyers: DGCA tweaks ticket refund, cancellation rules - check changes
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has revised refund norms, allowing passengers to cancel or modify tickets without extra charges within 48 hours of booking. Airlines are also barred from levying charges for name corrections within 24 hours of booking directly through their website. These changes aim to streamline the refund process and enhance passenger convenience.

title: Tony Dungy‚Äôs 17-Year NBC run in jeopardy as Kelce, Tomlin pass
content: NBC is reportedly set to overhaul its "Football Night in America" pregame show before the 2026 season, potentially ending Tony Dungy's 17-year tenure. The network sought active stars like Mike Tomlin and Travis Kelce, but both appear focused on continuing their playing careers rather than studio roles. NBC wants star presence and a sharper structure. Without Tomlin or Kelce stepping in, the network must decide whether to lean on fresh faces or rethink its strategy altogether. For now, Dungy‚Äôs future stands at the centre of that crossroads.

title: Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda drop first pics as husband & wife
content: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna have officially tied the knot in Udaipur, confirming their union as 'The Wedding of VIROSH'. The couple, who met on the sets of 'Geetha Govindam', celebrated their marriage with Telugu Hindu and Kodava rituals.

title: 'Nuke rhetoric won't save Pak next time': Army vows 'decisive victory' in future conflict
content: India's Western Army Commander, Lt Gen Manoj Kumar Katiyar, declared the army is fully prepared for future conflicts and undeterred by Pakistan's nuclear threats. He warned any future war would end decisively on the ground, asserting Pakistan's reliance on proxy warfare and misleading its populace.

title: 'No undercover work!' PM Modi meets Fauda star cast on Israel visit, posts selfie
content: PM Modi's meeting with the star cast comes as various stakeholders in the Indian and Israeli entertainment industries have been seeking collaborative projects and possibilities of utilising each other's strengths in various aspects of the creative space.  Last year, amid government efforts to make India a global film production hub, an Indian film festival kicked off in Israel with the screening of filmmaker Kiran Rao's acclaimed feature "Laapataa Ladies".‚Äã

title: Gold in ‚Äòstructural repricing phase‚Äô, could hit $6,000 in 12 months: Report
content: Gold's long-term outlook is bullish, with prices potentially reaching $5,000 per ounce by early 2026, according to MOFSL.  Global de-dollarisation, fiscal stress, and geopolitical tensions are driving this 'structural repricing phase'.  Analysts predict $6,000 in 12 months and $7,500 medium-term, citing investor confidence shifts and supply constraints.

title: 'Priyanka wasn't talking to me': Rahul on how Wayanad helped end sibling tiff - watch
content: Rahul Gandhi shared a light-hearted anecdote about resolving a sibling dispute with his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, attributing Wayanad's "magic" to their reconciliation. He recounted how a planned trip to the constituency, which he previously represented, led to Priyanka speaking to him again after a period of silence, highlighting the special connection he feels with the region.

title: 'We've utmost respect for judiciary': Edu min regrets NCERT book row, vows action
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan assured action against those responsible for a controversial Class 8 NCERT textbook chapter on judicial corruption. The Supreme Court had ordered a ban and seizure of the book, deeming its content objectionable and a potential conspiracy to defame the judiciary. NCERT has apologized and is rewriting the chapter.

title: Strike rate 331.58! Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's 19-ball 63 sends IPL 2026 warning
content: Young Indian star Vaibhav Sooryavanshi unleashed a blistering 19-ball 63, featuring seven fours and five sixes, in the DY Patil T20 Cup. This explosive innings, with a strike rate of 331.58, serves as a potent warning to IPL 2026 rivals. His fearless aggression, evident since his record-breaking IPL century, continues to dominate bowlers, making him a player to watch.

title: Sachin Tendulkar gets emotional as son Arjun gears up for wedding
content: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar expressed heartfelt joy as his son, Arjun, prepares to marry Saaniya Chandhok on March 5, 2026. The couple, engaged in August 2025, recently attended an Ambani event where Sachin shared his pride in Arjun finding a loving partner.

title: Ron Duguay reveals stage IV cancer battle, family launches GoFundMe
content: Ron Duguay, a former New York Rangers star now dating Sarah Palin, is battling Stage IV colon cancer. His daughters launched a $26,000 GoFundMe to help cover treatment and travel costs. According to Page Six, he has been fighting the disease for a year and has undergone major surgeries while continuing chemotherapy and other therapies.

title: 'India need to bring back their aggressive brand': Aakash Chopra's blunt warning
content: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra urges India to embrace their fearless, attacking style against Zimbabwe to revive semi-final hopes. He stressed the need for explosive batting, particularly from Suryakumar Yadav, and criticized the team's current cautious approach. Chopra warned that a failure to revert to their aggressive brand of cricket could jeopardize India's World Cup campaign.

title: Dinners, emails & texts: World Economic Forum chief quits over Epstein links
content: World Economic Forum president and CEO Borge Brende has resigned following disclosures of past interactions with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Brende stated his departure was to allow the WEF to continue its work without distractions. An independent review found no additional concerns beyond what was already known.

title: Champions League talking points: Madrid, PSG or Italian football -- who is worse off?
content: seventeen goals and three red cards in four games capped chaotic night . a 5-2 aggregate win over internazionale and 5-2 win over england . manchester united and chelsea both made light work of club brugge and FK Qarabag .

title: Bubble Watch: Georgia, Texas fall short of big wins -- but hold steady
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . teams have roughly three weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on their potential .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Way-too-early roster predictions for the 2026 MLB All-Star Game
content: it's time for our annual way-too-early All-Star selections . we predict who will make the trip to Philadelphia for the 2026 Midsummer Classic in 138 days . 34 players have hit 50 home runs in a season, with 23 doing it just once .

title: 'There's not one path': The unexpected rise of Keaton Wagler at Illinois
content: a hint of exasperation in underwood's voice as he ran through the well-worn tropes about Keaton Wagler . the coach is sensitive to minimizing Wagler's journey, or separating him from the group of freshmen who have taken over the men's college basketball season . underwood: "if the story is that everybody missed on him, we didn't"

content: the 2026 World Baseball Classic offers a unique opportunity to get a glimpse at some of baseball's stars of tomorrow . one of the most intriguing is Joseph Contreras, a prep right-hander in Georgia . he is best known for his time with the New York Yankees and Chicago White Sox .
